intro: Voyriella oxycarpha, commonly known as the sharp-lobed heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are leathery and have distinctive, pointed lobes, while its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Voyriella oxycarpha is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate poor soil conditions.
